title: Jeff Gordon
summary: Jeffery Michael Gordon[2] (born August 4, 1971) is an American former professional stock car racing driver,  currently an announcer for Fox NASCAR, and a top executive for Hendrick Motorsports. He raced full-time from 1993 to 2015, driving the No. 24 Chevrolet for Hendrick Motorsports in the former NASCAR Winston Cup Series and Sprint Cup Series (now called NASCAR Cup Series), and also served as a substitute driver for Dale Earnhardt Jr. in the No. 88 Chevrolet for Hendrick Motorsports in select races during the 2016 season.[3] He is regarded as one of the most influential drivers in NASCAR history, helping the sport reach mainstream popularity.
